verses.verse: The vision<WH2377> of Obadiah<WH5662>. Thus saith<WH559> the Lord<WH136> Jehovah<WH3069> concerning Edom<WH123>: We have heard<WH8085> tidings<WH8052> from Jehovah<WH3068>, and an ambassador<WH6735> is sent<WH7971> among the nations<WH1471>, saying<WH6965>, Arise ye<WH6965>, and let us rise up against her in battle<WH4421>.
Behold <WH5414>, I have made thee small<WH6996> among the nations<WH1471>: thou art greatly<WH3966> despised<WH959>.

The pride<WH2087> of thy heart<WH3820> hath deceived<WH5377> thee<WH7931>, O thou that dwellest in the clefts<WH2288> of the rock<WH5553>, whose habitation<WH3427> is high<WH4791>; that saith<WH559> in his heart<WH3820>, Who shall bring me down<WH3381> to the ground<WH776>?
Though thou mount on high<WH1361> as the eagle<WH5404>, and though thy nest<WH7064> be set<WH7760> among the stars<WH3556>, I will bring thee down<WH3381> from thence<WH5002>, saith Jehovah<WH3068>.

If thieves<WH1590> came<WH935> to thee<WH7703>, if robbers by night<WH3915> (how art thou cut off<WH1820>!), would they not steal<WH1589> only till they had enough<WH1767>? if grape-gatherers<WH1219> came<WH935> to thee<WH7604>, would they not leave some gleaning grapes<WH5955>?
How are the things of Esau<WH6215> searched<WH2664>! how are his hidden<WH4710> treasures sought out<WH2664>!

All the men<WH582> of thy confederacy<WH1285> have brought<WH7971> thee on thy way<WH1366>, even to the border: the men<WH582> that were at peace<WH7965> with thee have deceived<WH5377> thee<WH3201>, and prevailed against thee<WH3899>; they that eat thy bread lay<WH7760> a snare<WH4204> under thee<WH8394>: there is no understanding in him.
Shall I not in that day<WH3117>, saith<WH5002> Jehovah<WH3068>, destroy<WH6> the wise<WH2450> men out of Edom<WH123>, and understanding<WH8394> out of the mount<WH2022> of Esau<WH6215>?
And thy mighty<WH1368> men<WH8487>, O Teman, shall be dismayed<WH2865>, to the end that every one<WH376> may be cut off<WH3772> from the mount<WH2022> of Esau<WH6215> by slaughter<WH6993>.
For the violence<WH2555> done to thy brother<WH251> Jacob<WH3290>, shame<WH955> shall cover<WH3680> thee<WH3772>, and thou shalt be cut off for ever<WH5769>.

In the day<WH3117> that thou stoodest<WH5975> on the other side<WH3117>, in the day that strangers<WH2114> carried<WH7617> away his substance<WH2428>, and foreigners<WH5237> entered<WH935> into his gates<WH8179>, and cast<WH3032> lots<WH1486> upon Jerusalem<WH3389>, even thou wast as one of them<WH259>.

But look<WH7200> not thou on the day<WH3117> of thy brother<WH251> in the day<WH3117> of his disaster<WH5235>, and rejoice<WH8055> not over the children<WH1121> of Judah<WH3063> in the day<WH3117> of their destruction<WH6>; neither speak<WH6310> proudly<WH1431> in the day<WH3117> of distress<WH6869>.

Enter <WH935> not into the gate<WH8179> of my people<WH5971> in the day<WH3117> of their calamity<WH343>; yea<WH7200>, look not thou on their affliction<WH7451> in the day<WH3117> of their calamity<WH343>, neither lay<WH7971> ye hands on their substance<WH2428> in the day<WH3117> of their calamity<WH343>.

And stand<WH5975> thou not in the crossway<WH6563>, to cut off<WH3772> those of his that escape<WH6412>; and deliver not up<WH5462> those of his that remain<WH8300> in the day<WH3117> of distress<WH6869>.

For the day<WH3117> of Jehovah<WH3068> is near<WH7138> upon all the nations<WH1471>: as thou hast done<WH6213>, it shall be done<WH6213> unto thee<WH1576>; thy dealing shall return<WH7725> upon thine own head<WH7218>.

For as ye have drunk<WH8354> upon my holy<WH6944> mountain<WH2022>, so shall all the nations<WH1471> drink<WH8354> continually<WH8548>; yea<WH8354>, they shall drink, and swallow down<WH3886>, and shall be as though they had not been<WH3808>.
But in mount<WH2022> Zion<WH6726> there shall be those that escape<WH6413>, and it shall be holy<WH6944>; and the house<WH1004> of Jacob<WH3290> shall possess<WH3423> their possessions<WH4180>.

And the house<WH1004> of Jacob<WH3290> shall be a fire<WH784>, and the house<WH1004> of Joseph<WH3130> a flame<WH3852>, and the house<WH1004> of Esau<WH6215> for stubble<WH7179>, and they shall burn<WH1814> among them<WH398>, and devour them<WH8300>; and there shall not be any remaining to the house<WH1004> of Esau<WH6215>; for Jehovah<WH3068> hath spoken it<WH1696>.

And they of the South<WH5045> shall possess<WH3423> the mount<WH2022> of Esau<WH6215>, and they of the lowland<WH8219> the Philistines<WH6430>; and they shall possess<WH3423> the field<WH7704> of Ephraim<WH669>, and the field<WH7704> of Samaria<WH8111>; and Benjamin<WH1144> shall possess Gilead<WH1568>.

And the captives<WH1546> of this host<WH2426> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, that are among the Canaanites<WH3669>, shall possess even unto Zarephath<WH6886>; and the captives<WH1546> of Jerusalem<WH3389>, that are in Sepharad<WH5614>, shall possess<WH3423> the cities<WH5892> of the South<WH5045>.
And saviours<WH3467> shall come up<WH5927> on mount<WH2022> Zion<WH6726> to judge<WH8199> the mount<WH2022> of Esau<WH6215>; and the kingdom<WH4410> shall be Jehovah<WH3068>'s.
